title.narrative: Emergency Improved Non Food Items (NFIs) Support for Conflict Affected Population (New Arrivals) in Camps and Host Communities in MMC in Borno State

description.narrative:
This project aims to ensure the provision of emergency improved NFI materials, particularly for new arrivals and responding to the emergency needs of conflict affected populations in critical NFIs needs in MMC of Borno. This project consists of two key components: assessment of needs and procurement/distribution of improved NFIs. The urgent need for this project is as a result of increasing displacement of populations from other locations/LGAs into MMC and majority of them have been staying without any form of NFIs. This has been confirm by the July/August Assessment report of CCM/Shelter/NFIs gaps across some LGAs in Borno state. This project aims to meet the immediate life-saving humanitarian needs of an estimated newly displaced people from other part of Borno into MMC, most of whom are living in deplorable Conditions and urgently require humanitarian assistance especially NFIs. The proposed project is targeting new arrivals who have fled inaccessible areas and are in dire need of aid. This project will be focusing only on the provision of improved NFI kits to the most vulnerable in MMC and the activities will include, community social mobilization, need assessment, beneficiary registration, procurement, warehousing, transportation, direct distribution of improved NFIs and post distribution monitoring every two weeks after distribution as the distribution will be done on a rolling-on-going bases according the the needs and sector directives. In implementing this project GREENCODE will work closely with the Sector and the nationally approved guidelines and standard as uploaded in the Humanitarian Response Info will be used. Given the NFI needs for the new arrivals in the MMC and considering the important of providing lifesaving assistance, the project will procure, transport and distribute improved NFIs kits to the most vulnerable 1255 households such as female and child headed HHs among IDPs (new arrival) in MMC based on needs of the gaps jointly identified/agreed by GREENCODE and Shelter/NFIs sector in Borno state.
The distribution will be on a rolling/on-going basis as GREENCODE team will continue to assess, verify, and deliver assistance according to identified needs to affected populations wherever they are in MMC, and most likely in some in locations with gaps as directed and agreed with the Shelter/NFIs sector. In all stages of the project protection issues such as SGBV and child protection will be closely monitored and referred to appropriate partners for counseled and refer, also during distribution of NFIs. GREENCODE will work with IOM, SEMA, UNHRC and Protection sector to ensure gender and age awareness including in the dis-aggregation of data and the targeting of female¬ headed households, incorporating gender dynamics and the specific needs of different groups into needs assessments and response recommendations. Further, GREENCODE will pay special attention recognising the different needs of women and children as well as men and boys of different ages, we will ensure targeting criteria are taking into consideration specific vulnerabilities and needs. Also, in procuring NFIs and ensure that kit contents procured for this project are gender sensitive as well as easy to use by women in performing daily tasks.
